snippet: The Dutch police arrested about 200 people Thursday night and Friday morning for disregarding a ban on public assembly in The Hague rioting after the death of a man in police custody.
abstract: Dutch police arrest around 200 people for defying ban on public assembly in Schilderswijk neighborhood of The Hague; riots broke out in area for four nights after Mitch Henriquez, who was from Dutch Caribbean island Aruba, died in police custody.
lead_paragraph: The Dutch police arrested about 200 people Thursday night and Friday morning for disregarding a ban on public assembly in The Hague rioting after the death of a man in police custody.

headline.main: Netherlands: Protests Over a Death in Police Custody
headline.print_headline: Europe; Netherlands: Protests Over a Death in Police Custody
